DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Total Measured Tumor Burden Size Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total tumor size calculated as the sum of the longest diameters of non-nodal target and new non-nodal measurable lesions and the short axes of nodal target and new nodal measurable lesions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Total Measured Tumor Burden
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The sum of the longest diameters of non-nodal target and new measurable lesions and the short axes of nodal target and new measurable lesions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The sum of the longest diameters of non-nodal target and new measurable lesions and the short axes of nodal target and new measurable lesions.

Concepts.definition: The sum of the longest diameters of non-nodal target and new measurable lesions, and the short axes of nodal target and new measurable lesions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The physical magnitude of something.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
